ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: E-folded power law reflected from an ionized relativistic disk. XSpec model.

DESC.PARA: Exponentially cutoff power law spectrum reflected from an ionized relativistic accretion disk. In this model, spectrum of 'xspexriv' is convolved with a relativistic disk line profile ('xsdiskline'). See Magdziarz and Zdziarski 1995 MNRAS, 273, 837 for details of Compton reflection and Fabian et al. 1989, MNRAS, 238, 729 for details of the disk line profile.
This is an additive model component.

ROW.DATA: power law photon index, N_E prop. to E^(-PhoIndex)
the cutoff energy in keV (if foldE=0 there is no cutoff)
reflection scaling factor (1 for isotropic source above disk)
abundance of elements heavier than He relative to the solar abundances
iron abundance relative to the above
disk ionization parameter, xi = 4 pi F_ion/n, where F_ion is the 5 eV - 20 keV irradiating flux and n is the density of the reflector; see Done et al., 1992, ApJ, 395, 275
power law index for reflection emissivity; emissivity is proportional to r^Betor10
internal model accurancy - points of spectrum per energy decade
photon flux at 1 keV of the cutoff broken power law only (no reflection) in the observed frame

DESC.PARA: This information is taken from the XSpec User's Guide. Version 12.7 of the XSpec models is supplied with CIAO 4.4.
